intro: Peritoma angusta, commonly known as narrowleaf peritoma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for xeriscaping in arid regions. Its botanical features make it an attractive and drought-tolerant addition to gardens and natural landscapes.
